parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
Before, in the presence of, in the eyes of. Neuter of enantios; in the presence of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An answer, reply. From apokrinomai; a response.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Intrans: I am silent, keep silence; trans: I keep secret; pass: I am kept secret. From sige; to keep silent.
